title: Norway
text: The functionalities provided for Norwegian fiscal support are as follows: 1. Compatible Cash Drawer: A cash drawer with an "open" sensor is required for Norwegian fiscal support. 2. Logging and Printing Corrections: All corrections such as price changes and voided lines are logged and printed on the X/Z report. 3. Quantity Adjustments: Quantity adjustments are disabled in the POS when Norwegian fiscalization is activated. 4. Cash Drawer Open Restriction: Sales cannot be initiated while the cash drawer is open. 5. Cancelled Sales and Voided Lines: Cancelled sales are logged to the connector, and their values are printed on the X/Z report. Voided lines are also recorded as part of this process. 6. Manual Drawer Openings: All manual openings of the cash drawer are printed on the X/Z report. 7. Special Receipt Titles: Sales and return receipts have special titles: "Salgskvittering" for sales and "Returkvittering" for returns. 8. Total Sales, Returns, and Exchanges: The X/Z report will display the total number and values of sales, returns, and exchanges (currently in development). 9. Total Non-Sales/Returns/Exchanges: The X/Z report will show the total number and values of non-sales, returns, and exchanges (currently in development). 10. Journal Data Recording: All journal data will be recorded in a tamper-proof, exportable S-AFT format on the connector using blockchain technology (currently in development). To configure the Norwegian fiscal features in Imagine, you need to set up a Shop Feature in the Support Platform with the following details: Name: NorwegianFiscalisation Type: Fiscalisation Group: Fiscalisation Values: - Active: Boolean value indicating if the fiscalization feature is currently enabled for the shop. - reprintsAllowed: Number indicating the maximum number of reprints allowed for each receipt. Please contact your local support team for more information and assistance in configuring the Norwegian fiscal support in Imagine. Additionally, Imagine supports preventing the generation of a Cash Statement when there are open parked notes.
description:
The functionalities provided for Norwegian fiscal support are as follows:


1. Compatible Cash Drawer: A cash drawer with an "open" sensor is required for Norwegian fiscal support.


2. Logging and Printing Corrections: All corrections such as price changes and voided lines are logged and printed on the X/Z report.


3. Quantity Adjustments: Quantity adjustments are disabled in the POS when Norwegian fiscalization is activated.


4. Cash Drawer Open Restriction: Sales cannot be initiated while the cash drawer is open.


5. Cancelled Sales and Voided Lines: Cancelled sales are logged to the connector, and their values are printed on the X/Z report. Voided lines are also recorded as part of this process.


6. Manual Drawer Openings: All manual openings of the cash drawer are printed on the X/Z report.


7. Special Receipt Titles: Sales and return receipts have special titles: "Salgskvittering" for sales and "Returkvittering" for returns.


8. Total Sales, Returns, and Exchanges: The X/Z report will display the total number and values of sales, returns, and exchanges (currently in development).


9. Total Non-Sales/Returns/Exchanges: The X/Z report will show the total number and values of non-sales, returns, and exchanges (currently in development).


10. Journal Data Recording: All journal data will be recorded in a tamper-proof, exportable S-AFT format on the connector using blockchain technology (currently in development).


To configure the Norwegian fiscal features in Imagine, you need to set up a Shop Feature in the Support Platform with the following details:


Name: NorwegianFiscalisation

Type: Fiscalisation

Group: Fiscalisation


Values:

- Active: Boolean value indicating if the fiscalization feature is currently enabled for the shop.

- reprintsAllowed: Number indicating the maximum number of reprints allowed for each receipt.


Please contact your local support team for more information and assistance in configuring the Norwegian fiscal support in Imagine.


Additionally, Imagine supports preventing the generation of a Cash Statement when there are open parked notes.
